text: Gaultheria leschenaultii is a species of Gaultheria, native to the India and Sri Lanka. It is used as a medicinal plant in ayurveda. The plant is known as "Wel kapuru - වල් කපුරු" or "Wel kapuru - වෙල් කපුරු" by Sinhalese people.http://www.instituteofayurveda.org/plants/plants_detail.php?i=466&s;=Family_name The flowering period of the plant extends from April to May.http://biodiversityofsrilanka.blogspot.com/2013/12/wal-kapuruwel-kapuru- gaultheria.html ==References== == External links == *jstor.org *Pollen morphology or some selected plants from Horton Plains leschenaultii
title: Gaultheria leschenaultii
